*PUMA Men's Voltaic Evo Running Shoe***In the world of athletic footwear, finding the perfect balance between comfort, performance, and style can often feel like an impossible feat. But the *PUMA Men’s Voltaic Evo Running Shoe* rises to the occasion, offering an unparalleled combination of cutting-edge technology, sleek design, and all-day comfort that makes every run feel like a victory lap. Whether you're a seasoned marathoner, a weekend jogger, or someone just starting to get active, these shoes are engineered to take your performance to the next level, without compromising on style or durability.**The Perfect Fusion of Performance and Comfort**From the moment you lace up the *PUMA Voltaic Evo Running Shoe*, you’ll immediately notice the difference. It’s not just a running shoe—it’s a performance-enhancing tool that’s been meticulously designed to provide maximum support, flexibility, and comfort with every stride.At the heart of this shoe is its cutting-edge *IGNITE foam technology*, which offers exceptional energy return, cushioning, and responsiveness. The foam adapts to the unique needs of your foot, offering a soft yet springy feel that propels you forward with each step. Whether you’re running on pavement, trails, or even hopping onto a treadmill, the *Voltaic Evo* makes every footfall feel light and effortless, while still providing the support you need to push through the toughest runs.**Lightweight Yet Durable: Built for Long-Lasting Performance**One of the standout features of the *PUMA Voltaic Evo* is its **lightweight construction**. This shoe won’t weigh you down or slow you up, making it perfect for both long-distance runners and those who want a fast, responsive feel. The lightweight design means you can run longer without experiencing the fatigue that comes with heavier footwear, while the sturdy build ensures that the shoes will hold up even through intense training sessions.Despite being incredibly light, the *Voltaic Evo* doesn’t sacrifice durability. PUMA has designed these shoes with a reinforced **rubber outsole** that provides exceptional traction and grip. Whether you're running on slick surfaces or tackling uneven ground, you can rely on the shoe’s robust traction to keep you steady. The shoe’s outsole is crafted with strategically placed grooves to offer better flexibility, ensuring that your foot moves naturally while still providing grip where you need it most.**Breathable and Supportive: The Ultimate Fit**The *PUMA Voltaic Evo Running Shoe* is all about keeping your feet cool and comfortable, no matter how intense your workout may be. The engineered mesh upper ensures that your feet stay well-ventilated, reducing heat buildup and moisture during long runs. Say goodbye to uncomfortable sweaty feet and hello to a breathable, dry, and comfortable running experience.The shoe also features a **sock-like fit**, which provides a snug yet flexible embrace for your foot, preventing slipping or uncomfortable rubbing. The padded collar and heel counter offer extra support around the ankle, ensuring a secure and customized fit that adapts to the shape of your foot, giving you stability and confidence in every stride.**Sleek Design Meets Bold Innovation**Let’s talk about style. The *PUMA Voltaic Evo* doesn't just perform—it makes a statement. With its sleek, modern design, this shoe is sure to turn heads wherever you go. Available in a variety of colorways, you’ll find a look that suits your personal style—whether you prefer bold, eye-catching hues or more understated, minimalist tones. The distinctive PUMA branding adds a touch of flair, while the streamlined silhouette ensures that this shoe looks as good as it feels.Whether you’re using it as your go-to running shoe or as a stylish everyday sneaker, the *Voltaic Evo* offers a dynamic, athletic aesthetic that fits seamlessly into any wardrobe. Its design is as much about functionality as it is about making a bold statement.**Breath-Taking Comfort: Ideal for All-Day Wear**While the *PUMA Voltaic Evo* is undeniably a performance shoe, it’s also built for comfort throughout the entire day. The shoe’s cushioning system ensures that every step feels plush, while the flexible construction allows for natural movement, whether you're sprinting at full speed or walking casually around town. Its combination of breathability, support, and responsive cushioning means you can wear these shoes for hours on end without experiencing discomfort or fatigue. So whether you’re out on a run or running errands, the *Voltaic Evo* will keep your feet feeling fresh and comfortable all day long.**Perfect for Every Runner**The *PUMA Men’s Voltaic Evo Running Shoe* is engineered to meet the needs of every runner, from the beginner to the seasoned marathoner. Its combination of lightweight comfort, high-performance cushioning, and superior traction makes it an ideal choice for anyone who’s serious about improving their athletic performance. Whether you're hitting the pavement, the track, or your local trails, these shoes provide the right mix of support and flexibility to help you perform at your peak.For those who value a responsive and energetic feel underfoot, the *Voltaic Evo* excels. The shoe’s **IGNITE foam** cushioning system ensures that energy from each stride is returned, propelling you forward without requiring excessive effort. Its **outstanding traction** allows you to take on various surfaces with confidence, and its **sock-like fit** ensures that you’ll have stability without the risk of blisters or discomfort.**Final Verdict: The Running Shoe of the Future**In conclusion, the *PUMA Men’s Voltaic Evo Running Shoe* is a masterpiece of design and performance, blending cutting-edge technology with sleek aesthetics to deliver a shoe that’s not only functional but also a joy to wear. Its lightweight build, superior cushioning, and durable construction make it the perfect companion for runners of all levels, offering both comfort and performance in one dynamic package. The breathable upper, sock-like fit, and exceptional traction all come together to make the *Voltaic Evo* a truly exceptional choice for anyone who’s serious about their athletic endeavors.If you’re in the market for a running shoe that can keep up with your pace while still turning heads, look no further than the *PUMA Voltaic Evo Running Shoe*. Whether you’re racing down the track, running errands, or simply enjoying a leisurely jog, these shoes provide the comfort, support, and style you need to take on the day with confidence. Once you slip your feet into these shoes, you’ll quickly realize that the *Voltaic Evo* isn’t just a running shoe—it’s an experience.

Comfortable, true to fit. I will mention that the color on the sides looks like a brilliant blue in the photo, but is actually quite muted in reality. Also, the section in the heel that appears to be clear or otherwise translucent is actually solid black. Otherwise a good purchase, but maybe a little expensive for what they are. Incidentally, I have found some truly amazing articles of clothing on Amazon over the years, but lately a lot of what I have received has looked drastically different than what was pictured, often with the same listings on the site for years with no updates as presumably the products change. But I digress. In short, these Pumas have good arch support, are very comfortable, and feel good for picking up the pace on what little working out I do. Buy them, especially if you catch them for a particularly low price.

Review.review: These PUMA Riaze Prowl trainers are exactly what I was hoping for. The fit is true to size and super comfortable, even after wearing them all day. The cushioning gives really good support, especially for walking or light workouts, and I don’t end up with sore feet like I do in other sneakers. They’re also lightweight, so I don’t feel weighed down.On top of that, they look great. Sleek design, clean lines, and they go with just about everything from workout gear to jeans. I’ve already gotten compliments on them. If you want sneakers that feel good and look good, these are a win.
They are easy to slip on and do not rub the heels. They are lightweight with a decent heel height. They are great quality and have good support. They are pretty comfortable and have a good design.

My wife is a neonatologist, constantly on her feet and often sprinting to emergencies. These PUMA Riaze Prowl trainers are her new favorite. The comfort is unmatched, with cushioning that supports long shifts and sudden movement. The color scheme is subtle yet unique, adding a splash of personality without being loud. She’s worn them for work, travel, and casual outings, and they’ve held up beautifully. If you need shoes that combine performance with style, these are a standout.

I'm disappointed because this relationship started off really well. The shoes are adorable! Love the bright colors, nothing too loud, but definitely noticeable.  This is a very comfortable shoe with a Gel insert, so your steps are pretty cushioned and light. H O W E V E R, THERE ARE TOE-HOLES ON MY SHOES NOW!  To get an idea of the usage for wear and tear, I've used these shoes at the gym 5 days a week for 1.5 hrs for only the past 6 weeks - with only 25 minutes of that being cardio. I do not use these shoes for any other purpose.  I'm upset because these shoes wore out already! I'm not sure what type of resistance sneakers should withstand, but I can tell you that today I have shin splints (which I believe is because the insert has worn down) and I just noticed these toe holes!  For the record, I'm well groom with mani-pedi's so my toenail did not bust open this shoe!If you need this for the gym I do not suggest it unless you are ok with the life span and maybe alternate shoes.  However, if you just want a comfortable, cute set of kicks to hang out it, then you should show these guys off :)I get a lot of compliments!

These shoes feel comfortable and durable. I will definitely buy them again. I will say that I’m used to wearing cowboy boots and had to stop wearing them all the time due to medical reasons. But I am used to leather and leather-like items. But if you are not, these might feel warm if you wear them on a hot day. They have some airflow but they definitely aren’t like a running shoe for air flow. Cowboy boots allow no air flow so I’m used to it and I don’t have a complaint about it. They also have a strong leather smell when they are new, which is not my favorite smell but I’m used to it with cowboy boots again. But if you don’t like the smell of leather it might be overpowering at first. Overall nice shoes that are comfortable and look nice that I wear everywhere I go now. They fit well and don’t seem to untie themselves constantly like some shoes seem to. I wear them in wet grass all the time and they are waterproof in short grass. They have breathing holes across the top so if you step in a puddle that is over your shoe it will likely fill from the top and then you would have to take it off and actually dump it. Overall, great shoes.

title: PUMA Men's Softride Enzo 5 Cross Training Shoes Sneaker
Customer_say: Customers find these cross trainers comfortable, with one noting their feet don't hurt 24/7, and appreciate their build quality, value for money, and perfect fit. They receive positive feedback for their style and durability, with one customer mentioning they're great for walking and running. The slip-on feature and sturdiness receive mixed reviews, with some finding them strong while others report eyelets breaking after a month of use.

Review.review: As someone who's already bought and loved a pair of these, I can confidently say the PUMA Men's Softride Enzo 5 Cross Training shoes are a fantastic investment, so much so that this is my second pair. I've found them to be an excellent all-around shoe that provides comfort, style, and solid performance without a hefty price tag.​The "Softride" foam is the real star of the show here. The cushioning is incredibly comfortable right out of the box and provides a plush, responsive feel whether I'm walking, doing light jogging, or working out. It's a noticeable upgrade from many other shoes in this price range. The support and stability are also great for cross-training. The TPU cage gives you a locked-down feel, and the zoned rubber outsole provides reliable traction on a variety of surfaces, from gym floors to pavement.​Beyond the performance, they simply look great. The sleek design and clean lines make them versatile enough to wear not just for the gym but also for casual everyday use. The fact that PUMA uses at least 30% recycled materials in the upper is a nice bonus and something I appreciate as a consumer.​The long-lasting comfort is why I keep coming back to this model. My first pair held up incredibly well to daily use, and I expect the same from this one. If you're looking for a shoe that's comfortable for all-day wear, performs well during a workout, and doesn't break the bank, the PUMA Softride Enzo 5 is a perfect choice. Highly recommended.

Review.review: I recently picked up the PUMA Men's Viz Runner Sneakers, and they’ve quickly become my favorite pair for both workouts and casual wear. The design is sleek and modern, with just the right amount of flair to make them stand out without being too flashy. They’ve received a lot of compliments!Comfort-wise, these sneakers are fantastic. The cushioning provides great support, especially during long runs or extended periods of walking. The fit is snug but not too tight, and the breathable material keeps my feet cool, even during intense workouts.The durability of these shoes is impressive. After several weeks of regular use, they still look and feel like new. The grip on the sole offers solid traction, whether I’m on the treadmill, the trail, or just running errands around town.Overall, the PUMA Viz Runner Sneaker is a great choice for anyone looking for a stylish, comfortable, and reliable shoe. With their combination of style, comfort, and performance, they definitely deserve their 4.5-star rating. Highly recommended!

Review.review: I bought these shoes to get my feet wet in trail hiking / running.  I was and still am pleasantly surprised by what feels like a shoe that will hold up for the next 6 to 12 months at minimum as I put them through their paces ... not necessarily with what I had originally planned (trail hiking and running), but more so everyday life (work and play). I've tried some of the highest rated and more expensive shoes.  From a beginner running (9.5 min mile) standpoint and a person who tries to eat right and exercise everyday I would say that these shoes are a perfect fit for anybody's everyday activities. I work long 12-hour shifts and I'm constantly on my feet.  These shoes stood up to the time duration and did not cause my feet any discomfort.  They have just the right amount of padding, firmness and stability so that you feel confident with every step you take.  Granted I did not test these shoes in wet environments on varying surfaces (specifically smooth).  These shoes are said to be waterproof however I would probably caution people with regard to that and just say water resistant.  This is my first pair of Pumas and I am truly impressed.  For treadmill running I have a pair of Adizero Evos which are also fantastic but seem to be more environmentally limited due to their lack of semi cleated soles for outdoor running.  I'd highly recommend these Pumas as an everyday shoe.  They have served me well in varying environments including the rough sidewalks/streets of Tijuana MX.

I recommend ordering a half-size up In comparison to Nikes and Adidas. I wear a 10.5-11 in Adidas and Nikes and had to return a size 11 pair of these to get an 11.5 pair. The 11.5s are slightly snug and feel and look great. Should break in nicely but will update if not. First time buying Pumas and pleased so far.

title: PUMA Mens Redon Bungee Slip On Sneakers Shoes Casual - White
Customer_say: Customers find these sneakers comfortable, lightweight, and easy to slip on, with one customer noting they're excellent for golf. The style receives positive feedback, and customers like the fit, with one mentioning they're not too narrow. The laces receive mixed reviews - while one customer appreciates the bungee cord design, others note that the elastic straps are not adjustable.

Review.review: I just received these Puma Redon Bungee shoes today and they're exactly what I was looking for.Let me begin by debunking a few of the misconceptions about this shoe you'll find in other reviews here.  Apparently more than a few people did NOT realize what they were buying.  I saw complaints about the thin midsoles being uncomfortable to walk in all day.  Umm yeah, they weren't designed for walking.  And someone was complaining about the lack of arch support.  Once again, that is intentional.  This wasn't designed as a running shoe or a trainer.This is designed as a driving shoe.  It minimizes bulk.  So no bloated padded midsole like running shoes.  And outsole wear is not really a top priority so, the rubber outsole is thin too.  Also the sole is flat with zero heel drop unlike most running shoes.  And there is basically zero arch support on purpose.The reason for taking out all those "features" is to make a shoe that fits like a second skin.  Light, tightly fitted to your foot with no excess bulk to give you maximum space around the clutch, brake, and gas pedals in the car's footwell.  And that thin, flat midsole and outsole is designed to give you maximum feel of the pedals under your foot.  The rubber outsole is curved up the heel of the shoe for a reason, to prevent slip in your right foot when you are trying to heel and toe downshift a manual transmission.Can you wear these to walk from the car to a restaurant?  Sure.  Do you want to wear them to walk all day or for a 7 mile run?  No way.  These are a specialty shoe.  They are great on long drives.Puma sells to motorsports unlike most sneaker brands.  They have at least 3 other motorsports shoe lines, the Speed Cat, Drift Cat, and Future Cat.  But the Redon is the only one (I think) to offer a slip on bungee lace design.  I'm used to leather driving loafers for the street but those don't really look right with jeans or shorts.  So, I bought the Redon's as a casual driving shoe with the same slip on convenience a my leather driving loafers.  And truth be told, I'll use them as my house slippers too because they are easy to slide into or pop off.Another thing that may confuse people is that Puma also makes shoes for martial arts fighting on mats.  The Redon has a much of the same look as their fighting shoes.  Minimal bulk, skin tight fit, flat soles, rubber on the outside of the heel, light weight.  So it looks a lot like a fighting shoe which is another highly specialized product.So the Redon is not your usual casual sneaker or a running shoe.  But it's a really nice driving shoe that can be worn to walk a few blocks with no problem.  I like the clean minimalist look a lot.  I like the light weight.  I love the slip on feature.  And I love the thin sole that gives me great "feel" of what's under my foot.Another complaint I've seen here is the fit.  I wear a size 11D (medium width) in a running shoe so that's what I bought in the Redon Bungee.  They fit me fine in both length and width.  I didn't need to size up or down.  They are snug but easy to step into.  They feel secure on my feet but not so tight that they're annoying or painful.  But I'd advise anyone with wide feet to think twice about these.  They are made snug to work with the bungee lacing system.So all in all, I'm really happy with these driving shoes for the street.  At $40 they're a great value.  I may ditch leather driving moccasins altogether.

It turns out it's because there is a big hole on the inside of one shoe, exposing her heel to a hard surface. I contacted Puma because I wanted to return them and have a replacement pair sent, but they informed me they had "determined that there is no defect with this specific product that would qualify for a refund or reship." When I initially contacted them, they replied on October 22nd saying they would get back to me in 7-10 business days. They actually made me wait three full weeks (or 15 business days) before responding tonight (November 12th). All in all, this has been terrible customer service.As a big fan of Puma footwear (Speedcats in particular), and having worn nothing but them for the past decade, this experience has made me rethink my brand loyalty.I cannot recommend this shoe or brand in good faith to anyone.

Review.review: I recently wore the PUMA Caven 2.0 Men’s Sneakers for several weeks to test their comfort, fit, and style. Here’s my honest experience:Clean, classic designThe Caven 2.0 features a sleek, retro-inspired silhouette that pairs easily with jeans, joggers, or casual shorts. The minimalist style works for both casual outings and everyday wear.Comfortable cushioningThe padded insole and soft lining provide excellent comfort for all-day use. Whether walking around the city or running errands, my feet stayed comfortable and supported.Durable constructionThe upper materials feel sturdy and well-made. The outsole offers good traction and grip on a variety of surfaces, adding to the overall durability.Versatile color optionsThe neutral tones and simple design make them easy to match with different outfits. They’re a reliable go-to sneaker for any wardrobe.Lightweight feelDespite their sturdy build, these sneakers are surprisingly lightweight, reducing foot fatigue over long periods.Sizing runs slightly narrowIf you have wider feet, you may want to size up or try them on first for the best fit.Break-in periodThe leather-like material may feel a bit stiff initially. After a couple of wears, the sneakers soften and become more flexible.Not for high-performance sportsWhile great for everyday wear and light activity, these sneakers are designed more for lifestyle use than intense athletic performance.

title: Under Armour Men's Charged Assert 9 Running Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, well-designed, and lightweight, offering good value for money. They appreciate the fit, with one customer noting they're available in wide sizes. The durability receives mixed feedback - while some say they're holding up great, others report they wear down quickly. The sizing is also mixed, with some finding them true to size while others say they run small.

Review.review: Honestly one of the best shoes on the market for wide foot people, if your looking to snag a simple set of running sneakers, in my opinion. Here's some in-depth info along with  pro's and con's:TLDR: Great quality shoes for the price, and easy to clean. Recommend to beginner and intermediate runners/hikers, experts may be willing to pay more money for increase of quality.PROs:- Perfect Fit. I usually wear 9.0 wide (USA), so that is what I ordered and it fit perfectly.- Comfort and Ease. I like how comfortable they are and they are easy to slip on and off (if you wish) by the use of the heel pull tab. The tab also prevents the heel from getting bunched in or broken when putting on the shoes, which was a frequent problem with some other brands I have owned in the past.- Easy to Clean, Quality Mesh. I have seen some reviews saying these shoes wear out easily or the mesh is easier to damage. YMMV but I didn't seem to have this issue and I've had these shoes for about a year. IMO I find the mesh to be much more durable than the cloth mesh most sports shoes have these days and much easier to clean, which is essential for anyone like myself, who often hikes or runs in forestry/mud.- Above Average Quality. As for the year timeframe, the 1st set was about 8 months of extreme use, then I purchased a 2nd pair which I've had for about 3 months now. This may seem like a short timeframe to some but for me, I usually have to change shoes every 6 months or less if they are lower quality because they get a lot of mileage and use. I still have the 1st set which I use as "lawn mowing shoes", as they are still usable but the tread does not get much grip/traction anymore for running. I liked them enough to buy that 2nd pair instead of some other brand/model.- Decent Arch Support and Sole Tread. You will find other shoes with the same or better, but I didn't see many that were this cheap in price.- Part of Amazon's "Try Before You Buy". Free try-ons. You can take up to 6 days to decide whether to keep/return if you wish, and only be charged if not returned by the 7th day. Day 1 is the day they are delivered.- Uniform in Color. The shoe currently comes in all-black or all-white, including the logo. YMMV but this is a pro for me due to work restrictions requiring all-black shoes, so I can also wear them leisurely at work if I choose (I'm a mechanic). Great for anyone with the same issue, or military, etc.CONs:- Not the most expert/elite quality shoe out there, but will definitely check most people's boxes for average needs, imo.- Cost is higher than one might desire for just simple leisure shoes. But as an avid runner, the price is about average. However, they are usually on sale. My 1st set was around 40% off which dropped it from $70-something to $43, which was worth it for me. 2nd set was about 20% off. Winter holiday seems to be the best time for sales price.- Tread pattern is smooth and circular, instead of rigid and square/triangle, in case that matters to you (in regards to rock climbing etc)Overall I was surprisingly satisfied with this shoe model personally, but your mileage may vary.

Under armour shoes are stylish, comfortable and durable. My grandson is 10 and wears an 11 1/2 men's shoes. These are the only brand shoes that holds up to the hard playing. TLDR: Excellent lifestyle sneakers, but strictly for walking or casual use. Not built for athletic performance.These sneakers are stylish and incredibly comfortable — for walking and everyday casual wear. The leather upper gives them a premium look, and the overall construction feels solid and well-made. They work perfectly as lifestyle shoes and are great for running errands, light strolling, or just pairing with a laid-back outfit.However, do not buy these for running or high-impact activities. They’re quite heavy and have an extremely soft, squishy sole that offers little to no responsiveness or support for running. Attempting to run in them feels unstable and could potentially lead to injury due to the lack of proper support and cushioning dynamics for that kind of movement.

What can you say about such a timeless and classic tennis shoe. I'm not sure of the type suede they are made of but it wears hard resists water and bleeding and cleans up nicely.These shoes have been around for decades , back when the tennis shoe was sold and made for playing tennis. Now they are much of a statement of your style as they are their utility.From gangsters to Lady Gaga This puma classic looks as good with the Mobsters velor tracksuit to a faded pair of Levi 501s on Sunday mornings.Construction Wise it's a lot of shoe for the money they wear hard and long. the soles are non-marring, the uppers glued and stitched. The matching color laces laces are extra wide and probably will last as long as the shoe itself, mine came with a pair of extra white laces should you not like the colored laces that they are shipped with.i wear a size 13 shoe , all Nikes are too narrow for me and some others such as Skechers are sometimes too wide this Puma seems true to size in this form.I have had a pair of the non classic leather tennis shoes that were a little bit narrow and constricted at the toe.In all fairness these fit perfect. Priced Right at $60 delivered on Amazon prime they come in several colors I'm sure you'll be pleased with whatever you choose,  so if you're on the fence get them you won't regret it.Warm regardsy Jerry and Honeycutt Jr.

I hate buying a pair of sneakers online that seem like such a great bargain, then they come in the mail and seem stiff, without any comfortable padding, and they just seem like terrible knock offs. I mean, the inside bottom sole isn't cushioned at all, and the sides walls of the sneaker aren't soft or cushioned at all either. Then it hits you, this is why these sneakers were cheap. BUT...these Pumas are not those cheaply made ones. The look great, they are truly classic Puma suede, and feel awesome on my feet. They are soft and padded nicely on the inside around the ankle and on the sole. As I stated in the headline, for $29.99, I should have bought multiple pairs! I love the grey/white look. I was watching these last year, and they dropped from $60 to $39. I wanted to purchase them last year, but didn't, and I was heart broken to see later that the price jumped back up to $60. My wife and I were sitting on the couch before this past Christmas, and she pointed out to me, "aren't these the sneakers you were looking at awhile ago?" She pointed out the incredible $29.99 price drop, and I "clicked to buy" immediately! If they offer them in other colors, still at that price, I might just get more!  In case you are wondering, I highly recommend these to any Puma lover, or anyone who loves great sneakers.  **Please note, I marked that these fit as expected. They fit as expected for a Puma sneaker. I have wide D sized foot. Pumas run a wee bit on the narrow side. These still fit great though**

Review.review: I have five pair of these shoes in different colors and they are, for me, the perfect shoe. They are comfortable for walking, standing, and give all day comfort. I am 5'10 175 lbs and wear a 10 medium. They fit true to size for me. I've worn them for about twelve hours on some days and never had a thought about them. They give great feedback while driving. I have a Porsche six speed and these are great driving shoes. I find the sole to have the perfect balance between to much and not enough cushion. Usually you get one or the other, but these shoes give both. I don't find them to slip on any surface but that's not to say they don't, I just haven't found that surface. I have been wearing them for about six months.

My 80yr old Dad prefers this style of Puma shoes. He says they help his feet feel better (he has nerve pain). I believe they help with compression without being too tight. This is his second pair. Length sizes run normally, although they are more narrow than most sneakers.

The Red is more toned down than I expected - it could stand to be a few shades lighter IMHO - I have multiple Puma shoes with Red, and this is definitely darker in appearance than the others;  I'm not sure that I'm going to keep them - I'm on the fence with this color. Review.review: Early review:  They arrived last night in a plastic bag not marked with a string or label like most new shoes.They are nice looking and I love the material. I work on my feet and have a spur on my heel that irritates my achilleas. I need a show with a raised heel but also extreme comfort to the soles. Recently a ganglion cyst formed on the top of my foot. It goes down when I am not wearing my comfortable but boxy Clogs work shoes.I needed something to match the comfort of my expensive Clogs but soft enough not to irritate the cyst on the top of my feet that was rubbing against the rubber rib eight hours a day. The price was a fourth of the price of the average professional work shoe.The Shoe came with a terrible insert and I changed them at once. They were lumpy, thin foam. The shoe fits snug around the toes but like a sock to the top of your feet. If you want to wear socks go up a half to a whole size.They fit and feel like wearing swimming socks with thick rubber soles of a running shoe.I wore them out for a few hours and decided thin socks would be needed due to sweaty feet without socks. One review said they were over hot. I did not find them so. A few reviews said they cramped the toes  and it was true at first, but not too bad. A co worker purchased the same shoes said she found the toes cramped but they took form later and is not longer an issue.I am on my feet for 8 hours straight and  10-18k steps a shift. Comfort is required. After my first night wearing them I love them. My toes were a bit tight at first but not too much. I never felt discomfort. I love the lift and the running shoes soles. It is like having the best of both worlds in socks across the top and strong soles together with a pleasant look. I strongly recommend these shoes and have to my co workers.On an extra note after a few days of wearing the shoes, the toes no longer feel tight.  I will be buying more colors to wear casually in place of my other tennis shoes.

Very unimpressed with packaging since I thought shoes would come in a box, instead they were just wrapped together in plastic wrap.  They did look new though so i unwrapped and WOW!  When I put them on, I didnt take them off until I went to bed.  They were so incredibly comfortable.  I have very fussy feet and so it’s often times hard to find comfortable shoes for being on my feet or walking for long distances or several hours.  These are very light weight and should keep my feet cool enough in the  summer heat.  Since they do not have lacees, i wondered if my feet would be secure enough and stay in place, and they do.  My right foot pronates inward and this shoe seems to have the right support to keep my feet well aligned.  I highly recommend,

I have purchased two pairs of these shoes and both are wearable.On the first walk, I found the soles of shoes were slippery but after about five minutes they became resistant and have good traction on tile, carpet and sidewalks.Another reviewer stated that the shoes do not slip on easily and I agree.  They are hard to get on.  The sole thickening is 2.1 inch at the heel which makes it difficult to slip you heel in with having to tug on the back to pull them in position.  I don't mind because once they are on, they feel good and comfortable.  I wear them without socks all day with no discomfort.  They are very easy to get off.I wash mine after every use by removing the inner cushion and tossing them in the washer.  I place them outside to dry.  I have tried many of the other slip on walking shoes and for the price, I like these the best.

I  purchased these sneakers because I wanted my 94 year young parent to not have to fight with getting shoes on and tieing them up. These are the perfect shoe and she says the are very comfortable, plus they look good on. I highly recommend to anyone who wants the ease of putting on and no worries about untied laces. Material is sweater like and looks rich in this color.

I was excited to get some slip-on shoes since Sketchers decided to stop making their VERY nice Leather slip-on shoes. When I received these new shoes I ordered 3 of them since my size sells out fast. Two of the pairs this one was only in a plastic bag no shoe box. I was told they would be received all together in one order, NOPE; one pair came one day and so on! Hate it when that happens!I put the shoes on and they were larger than the normal 5.5 size. Your foot slipped forward and backwards in the shoe when walking, and then something odd happened. I turned a corner and my foot slipped right over the side of the shoe with damn near breaking my ankle. It shook me so bad that after that incident you had to be real conscious of foot placement for each foot. Making sure you carefully was square on the floor. My ankle still hurts and I’m so glad I didn’t fall with just having a total shoulder replacement. This shoe absolutely has NO ANKLE support! If you are light on your feet, have a hip replacement or shoulder replacement these shoes are NOT for you. They don’t keep your feet from getting wet either. I wanted them as I can use only one arm to put shoes on. BUT who wants to wear them outside in the rain and get wet feet. The soles are made of “HARD PLASTIC” and they also slip on the carpet and floors. The inside of the shoe is also slick; they do however have good padding in them with arch support. Terrible design! Loved the Leather Sketchers Slip-On shoes with arch support and padding, but hate this bad yarn design. Just VERY disappointed! My doctor gave them a very bad review too! In the photo you can see the heal slips right over the side of the shoe.

When I first tried these shoes in they felt so comfy and lightweight. However after a day or two I realized that they aren’t comfortable after more than a short distance.They have minimal support on the sides and ankle so beware if you have ankle issues.

title: PUMA Unisex-Child Attacanto Indoor Training Soccer Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these indoor soccer shoes to be of good quality, particularly suitable for futsal, and appreciate their durability, with one customer noting they lasted through an entire indoor soccer season. They are comfortable, stylish, and come in appealing colors, offering great value for money. Customers like the fit, with one mentioning they work well on both hard court and indoor turf surfaces.

Review.review: The PUMA Attacanto Indoor Training Sneakers are an absolute game-changer for my kid’s training sessions! From the moment we got them, I could tell these shoes were built for both performance and style.First off, the Electric Peppermint Black colorway is amazing—bright and bold, but not too flashy, and it definitely stands out. My child loves how they look, and they’ve received so many compliments! The sleek design with a pop of color makes them perfect for both indoor training and casual wear.In terms of comfort, these sneakers are top-notch. The fit is true to size, and the shoes offer excellent support. The cushioned insole and breathable upper keep their feet comfortable even after hours of movement, whether they’re on the court or just running around. The rubber sole provides great grip, so no slipping during quick pivots or sprints.I also love how versatile they are. These sneakers are built to handle a range of indoor sports, from basketball to training drills. And they hold up really well, even with regular wear. My child says they feel light and responsive, which is great for agility.Overall, the PUMA Attacanto sneakers are a fantastic investment. They’re stylish, durable, and offer the perfect balance of comfort and performance for active kids. Highly recommend!

These PUMA Kids' Attacanto Indoor Training Soccer Shoes have been great for my daughter! She’s been wearing them for the past few months, and they’ve held up really well. The fit is comfortable, the grip is solid, and they provide great support for indoor play.For the price, they’re a great value, and I’ll definitely be buying them again when she needs a new pair. Highly recommend for any young soccer player! ⚽👏

Review.review: good ones ❤️

Super stylish and sleek, but the hook and loop closures are rather small. I’m happy the shoes stretched a bit the more I wear them. They’re a little noisy, though —- they sound like the dress shoes I wore in the service. They’re easy to wipe off to keep them looking good. I enjoy them quite a bit… enough to consider a second pair.

These make great cycling shoes, and I don’t bike long-distance without them!  A few things to note…  Buy one size larger, this shoe comes in smaller than the shoe size.  I wear a size eleven and this size twelve fits perfectly.  My first pair of Puma track/driving shows four years ago.  My first pair of Puma driving shoes lasted for four years of cycling before they started to fall apart.  For cycling (or driving) these shoes are really comfortable, fit great, have great quality, and the Velcro closures solve the only problem I had with my old Puma's - the shoelaces get caught in the bike gears.  I highly recommend this shoe to cyclists and drivers.Last notes…  These are not shoes for anything other than short walking distances – they aren’t designed for walking, they’re designed for driving while seated, and in my case and others cycling while sitting.  And finally, the soles of this shoe can be very slippery when wet so take care.

I use these shoes strictly for driving as I have a long commute and sometimes drive a windy road. They work very well for that reason, which is why I recommend these shoes for utility purposes only (driving/sports). I do NOT recommend for casual wearing at all. I only walk in these shoes for short distances and can tell my feet would hurt if I wore them all day. Also, the shoes would fit tight even with no show socks. I don't wear socks when wearing them.  So if you are looking for shoes to go with an outfit, don't buy these. But if your plans are to wear them for driving or some specific sport, these are good for the price.

Was looking for sim racing shoes on a budget. Looked into water shoes but was put off by the many reviews stating the soles were too soft. Saw these and figured, for $27 what the hell. I was previously using regular shoes that would occasionally cause me to press the accelerator while braking because of how wide they were. These taper towards the front which completely eliminated the accidental accelerator presses. The sole is stiff enough to give you great feel and they’re very light. They’re not as breathable as I’d like them to be but they’re not bad. I’ve worn them for several hours and never found them to be uncomfortable. If you’re looking for budget sim racing shoes, I’d highly recommend these. They even look the part! Well, time to get back to Forza, or GT7, or iRacing, whichever one doesn’t trigger you.

title: PUMA Men's Club Ii Era Sneaker
Customer_say: Customers find these shoes comfortable, with one noting the thick insoles, and appreciate their quality, with one highlighting the quality knitting on the leather. They are stylish and come in a beautiful brown color, with positive feedback about the cushioning, and one customer mentions the rubber outsole offers good traction. Review.review: I recently purchased the PUMA Club II Era sneakers, and they've quickly become my go-to pair for daily wear. The combination of leather and suede in the upper gives them a sleek, retro-inspired look that pairs well with various outfits. The SoftFoam+ sockliner provides excellent cushioning, making them comfortable for extended periods of walking or standing.The fit is true to size, but if you have wider feet, you might consider going half a size up, as they have a slightly narrow profile. The rubber outsole offers good traction, and the overall construction feels durable and well-made.Overall, these sneakers strike a perfect balance between style and comfort. Whether you're dressing up or keeping it casual, the PUMA Club II Era is a versatile choice that doesn't disappoint.

title: PUMA Men's Attacanto Indoor Trainer Soccer Shoe Sneaker
Customer_say: Customers find these soccer shoes to be of great quality, with beautiful colors and good grip. They are comfortable and worth the $25 price tag. The fit and sizing receive mixed feedback - while some say they fit great, others find them too tight. The durability is also mixed, with customers noting they are not flimsy, though one customer reports issues with the sole separating from the upper.

Review.review: The material of the boot itself is thin in a good way. It feels one with my foot since it's a snug fit. The sole is thin so you feel close to the ground, but absolutely not flimsy. It's a full rubber sole and plenty grippy and flexible.They do run small and narrow, but I prefer tight and snug for soccer cleats because I make better and more reliable/predictable contact with the ball, and my feet stay planted and don't move within the shoe.Running shoes I size like regular shoes but lace them tight and snug. Soccer cleats I size them small and tight so that the boot/shoe itself is snug and not forced by laces which is difficult to tighten and also makes for pressure points...snug cleats don't cause pressure points and are easily snug without relying so much on laces, for me. These are great and well worth the $25!!I wear a 12 in Mizuno andSaucony running shoes, and 12 in these Pumas feels pretty damn tight on me on width and length. 12.5 may be better and I could probably wear them all day, but it'd still be unusually snug on the width...but that'd be good for soccer. The 12s on me I wore for 4 hours and my feet weren't hurting at all, but when I took them off, I enjoyed the feeling of them being off. My toes are pretty much at the very end of the toe box on these 12s, yet I have a comfortable gap on my running shoes. I'm keeping the 12s because they're so smug and great. I'll probably buy longer laces so I can loosen them more easily without difficult tying.I'm not regretting my purchase at all, just sharing my experience.

Good feeling, adequate to my feet

I have been a loyal fan of Puma sneakers for years, appreciating their consistent fit and comfort across various styles. However, my recent experience with a new pair in men's size 10.5, a size I've comfortably worn in other Puma styles, left me notably disappointed. These sneakers felt unusually tight and seemed to be undersized, a stark contrast to the reliable sizing I've come to expect from the brand.Initially, I held onto the hope that the shoes would stretch and conform to my feet after a period of breaking in. This optimism led me to keep the sneakers past the point of return. Regrettably, they did not improve in fit as I had hoped, which ultimately rendered them unwearable for me. Acknowledging my misjudgment in not returning them immediately, I've decided to donate the shoes to Goodwill.This experience serves as a reminder of the variability that can occur in manufacturing and the importance of addressing fit issues promptly. While this has been a setback in my history with Puma, it also highlights the need for careful consideration when trying new styles, even from brands we know and trust.
